page.title: 15LLANGURIG, LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Three main historical features of the village are the{church, the fountain {and the cenotaph. { Saint Curig's Church}has been renovated in 1984/85. It has been re-roofed, the spire re-clad in copper and the tower re-pointed. The church was founded by Saint Curig who died in A.D.550. The present church dates from the 15th century. The tower was built in 1330. The lychgate was erected in 1740. The{fountain}was a gift of a water supply to the village by George Hope Lloyd Verney in 1888. He was a local benefactor. The{cenotaph}is sited at the junction of the main road and the Clochfaen road. There are plans to re-locate it by the church.
